content:
Sure, you can add a `time_to_deliver` column in the `room_service_reviews` table to store the amount of time it takes from ordering to receiving the room service.
```sql
CREATE TABLE room_service_reviews (
  id serial PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id integer REFERENCES users(id),
  hotel_id integer REFERENCES hotels(id),
  date date NOT NULL,
  rating integer NOT NULL,
  review text NOT NULL,
  time_to_deliver interval NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id, hotel_id) REFERENCES user_hotel(user_id, hotel_id)
);
```
The `time_to_deliver` column is of type `interval`, which allows you to store a time duration in PostgreSQL.
